result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen M Fischer

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on November 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on November 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:47 PM Defendant Stephen M Fischer appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Per Atty Osberg DE must call the PD office for qualification. Victims are present in court. Mr Fischer makes a statement to the court, does not wish to have a no contact in place.  State has concerns about the victims safety, asks for no abusive contact and no discussion of the case, absolute sobriety. 

$5000.00 sign bond, no physically or verbally abusive contact with the victim, no discussion of the case with anyone in  the household, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. 

Court informs parents there is to be no alcohol is the home.  Adj 2:20pm

No physically or verbally abusive contact with the victim, no discussion of the case with anyone in  the household, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.
